name: corrode
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If metal corrodes, or if something corrodes it, it is slowly damaged by something such as rain or water: Steel tends to corrode faster in a salty atmosphere.

to destroy or be destroyed, esp. by acid or rust, usually over a long period of time: [ T ] Rain water corroded the metal pipes. corrosion noun [ U ] us
